appendix.title: Partitioning for the &sap; System Using &ay;
appendix.para: Partitioning for the &sap; system is controlled by the files from the directory /usr/share/YaST2/include/sap-installation-wizard/. The following files can be used:
The files will be chosen as defined in /etc/sap-installation-wizard.xml. Here, the content of the element partitioning is decisive.
If the installation is, for example, based on HA or a distributed database, no partitioning is needed. In this case, partitioning is set to NO and the file base_partitioning.xml is used.

note.title: autoinst.xml Cannot Be Used Here
note.para: autoinst.xml is only used for the installation of the operating system. It cannot control the partitioning for the &sap; system.

appendix.para: The files that control partitioning are &ay; control files that contain a partitioning section only. However, these files allow using several extensions to the &ay; format:

listitem.para: If the partitioning_defined tag is set to true, the partitioning will be performed without any user interaction.
By default, this is only used when creating &hana; file systems on systems certified for &hana; (such as from Dell, Fujitsu, HP, IBM, or Lenovo).

For every partition, you can specify the size_min tag. The size value can be given as a string in the format of RAM*N. This way you can specify how large the partition should minimally be (N times the size of the available memory (RAM)).

procedure.title: Creating a Custom &sap; Partitioning Setup
procedure.para: The steps below illustrates how to create a partitioning setup for TREX. However, creating a partitioning setup for other applications works analogously.

step.para: In /usr/share/YaST2/include/sap-installation-wizard/, create a new XML file. Name it TREX_partitioning.xml, for example.
Copy the content of base_partitioning.xml to your new file and adapt the new file to your needs.
Finally, adapt /etc/sap-installation-wizard.xml to include your custom file. In the listitem for TREX, insert the following line:

important.title: Do Not Edit base_partitioning.xml
important.para: Do not edit base_partitioning.xml directly. With the next update, this file will be overwritten.

appendix.para: For more information about partitioning with &ay;, see &ay; Guide, Chapter Partitioning (&docaddress;).
